p: The incubation period of the disease is 5-6 d on average but can be up to 14 d. Critical epidemiological and immunological aspects of the disease are that an infected person may be contagious 1-3 d before the onset of the symptoms[ 47]. About 40% of COVID-19 patients experience mild clinical course, and another 40% present with moderate disease. Severe disease that requires oxygen support is observed in about 15% of the patients. Five percent of the infected ones develop a severe disease that progresses to respiratory failure (ARDS) but also sepsis and septic shock, thromboembolism, multiorgan failure, including acute kidney, and cardiac injury[ 48]. Advanced age, smoking, as well as comorbidities such as diabetes, hypertension, cardiac and chronic lung disease, cerebrovascular diseases, immunosuppression, and cancer have been reported to predispose to a severe course of COVID-19. Children and infants usually experience mild disease or asymptomatic infection[ 49].
